reviewText: This is pretty attractive little game if you look the graphics, but needs to be polished in some details. Before you start playing I recommend to disable SSR setting, otherwise you may experience some troubles with light and textures. Also, when the game starts you get a black screen which is actually night, but you might think this some freeze or bug, just need to turn around and see the light
voteText: 52 of 70 people (74%) found this review helpful 6 people found this review funny

reviewText:
This game has a great idea behind it.. why oh why couldn't it have been developed by a proper competent developer?

The game claims that almost all things can be interacted with, this is far from true.
And the actual interaction system is horrible, you don't pick stuff up and look at it and move it around in your hand like you'd expect, you drag it across the floor, you drag a magazine or a cup across the floor.

The movement in the game is bad, and the lighter to give you some light is so weak that I had to look at my keyboard to make sure I pressed the correct button then I looked down at my feet in-game and saw a spec of light.

No subtitles, no key-rebinding. And why is the flashlight(lighter) bound to the button L? Why not T or Q or something closer to the rest of the buttons.
Horrible, absolutelly horrible performance. I have a pretty damn strong PC and I was lagging all over and my FPS was in the ground, I had to turn everything to the worst setting to be able to play without ripping my hair out.

The game tries to be scary, it tries to be some sort of horror but fails.
The only scary thing if you really want it to be scary is the vocie of a woman talking, and her voice is extremely low, if you want to be able to make out any words then you'll have to turn your windows volume WAY up which will make you deaf as there is no in-game volume sliders, so all other sounds will probably blast your eardrums out.

This game is simply unfinished. I don't.. I can't phatom why this was released as a finished product when it's clearly not. Why not just wait until it's finished or at least put it in early access.
I'm really sad that this game got released so early, I bet if this game was released when it was actually finished, you know, when the game is playable performance-wise, when you've finished the options menu, it would've been so much better but now you've tainted everyone with a bad experience to this game.

I can only assume that most of the positive reviews where for a CD-Key to the game or something. No one in their right mind would rate this game good.

And by the way I'm pretty sure that the developers or something are going around disliking all negative reviews because as far as I can see most negative reviews instantly get like 2 or 3 dislikes.

Edit: And yea, I almost instantly got 2 downvotes, cool.
voteText: 26 of 30 people (87%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Edit: Looks like they are slowly updating things, so this review may or may not be relevant. They seem to care about making the game polished.

This would be ok if it was free , and was optimized. I assume it is either some kind of effect, or badly optimized physics asset (in Unity), but the game stutters a lot, and makes it nearly unplayable (On a decent system).  (Game runs OK now. Not great... but it's playable). There are still a lot of issues, and honestly, and I only realize that now that I can play it with better performance.

The game itself starts off like a horror, but itsn't at all. It has a scary voice, and background noises, so you think something will jump out.

It should also warn you that there is no save.

Honestly, this feels like someone took a few Unity assets and mashed them together in a way that looks beautiful,  but doesn't at all mesh well but meshes together only ok. Absolutely NOT ready for free or pay. I'll recommend this once the performance is better.. ****At least put this game in early access / alpha. This is ridiculous***

Some more issues:
-Turning on the lights is a bit of a chore. When you point at a light, the dialog should come up... but sometimes you have to fish for it.
-Turning items around in 3D when picking them up is not clear... should be instructions.
-I got stuck in the bedroom, inside the walking closet. The chair fell back and trapped me in, and there's no jump option. So I closed out immediately.
-Would be nice if there was a symbol that popped up over an item so you know you're centered on it... like Dreamfall Chapters, or Life is Strange.
- At the beginning it says press E" to look
recommended: and seems like the character looks before you do that\n\nIt just isn't polished yet."

reviewText:
This game is not finished.
There is nothing wrong with that, that's what early access is for, but this game is sold as a finished product, and it is not.

Collisions are bad, graphic optimization is bad, text scroller do not reset, no text to tell you to press E to read things, doors will sometime close right after you open them and get too close, lighter is so weak that i thought it didn't work until i looked at my feet, english translation is not so good, no subtitles, etc.

This game looks promising, but it is not finished and came out as a release too soon. I hope devs will fix all the problems but until then, i can't rate it positively.

reviewText: Could be interesting, if it wasn't so horribly laggy (in a Windows 8 laptop that can run much bigger games without any problems). Also, the lagging causes a lot of jerks, which in turn are causing motion sickness, so at least for me, this game is unplayable. Played about 30 minutes before giving up and leaving it running for long enough to get the cards. At least I got this in a bundle, so I didn't pay full price.

reviewText: Not playable. I got 70-100fps in BF4 on ultra and 25-40 here. Physics are broken and it is hard to use objects/doors and also dark as hell. You have a lighter but it lights up only ground under your feet and objects 1-2 steps in front of you which doesn't help much.\nBut I must admit graphics in home are very good and textures looks pretty high res, good work here. This time you really get what you see on screenshots, no fake here. But game needs a lot of optimisation and normal lighter/flashlight or at least Brightness options (which is obvious btw) for outdoor exploring.

reviewText:
I really don't know how this got any good reviews. Let me give you a list of everything wrong with this game.
The English translation is terrible.
Your player movement is comparable to a slug.
No matter how good of a computer you have, this game will be shutter like crazy.
The goal of the game is not clear
The entire game is covered in blackness unless you find some lights. (Its so dark I found it very difficult to know where I was going half the time)
The locations of the keys are terrible (You need keys to open some doors)
I used a key to open a drawer and there was nothing inside it. ???? Why ... why would you do this?
Explanation to what you do in this game is pretty much nonexistent
The only music I heard was in the title screen. (granted I could not finish the game because I could not find the last key to open the last locked door. and there are no guides explaining where its location is).
In short, this game is terrible. Don't buy it.
